FuncDef: The display port forwarding-path command displays the outbound interface of packets that contain specified 5-tuple information, source MAC address, and destination MAC address. The display port forwarding-path command displays the outbound interface of packets that contain specified 5-tuple information, source MAC address, and destination MAC address. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display port forwarding-path { src-ip <src-ip-data> [ <ip-mask-len> | <source-ip-mask> ] | dst-ip <dst-ip-data> [ <ip-mask-len> | <dst-ip-mask> ] | src-mac <src-mac-data> | dst-mac <dst-mac-data> | protocol { <protocol-number> | gre | icmp | igmp | ip | ipinip | ospf | tcp [ l4-src-port <src-port-data> | l4-dst-port <dst-port-data> ] | udp [ l4-src-port <src-port-data> | l4-dst-port <dst-port-data> ] } }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a source IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 32.

Specifies the subnet mask of the source IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a destination IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the subnet mask of the destination IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a source MAC address.
The value is in H-H-H format. An H is a hexadecimal number of 1 to 4 digits.

Specifies a destination MAC address.
The value is in H-H-H format. An H is a hexadecimal number of 1 to 4 digits.

Specifies the protocol number or type.
protocol-number specifies the protocol number.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 255.
The protocol type can be:
GREICMPIGMPIPIPINIPOSPFTCPUDP

Specifies the source port number.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 65535.

Specifies the destination port number.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 65535.

ExtraInfo: The 5-tuple information contains the source/destination IP addresses, source/destination port numbers, and protocol type. Traffic on each interface often carries different 5-tuple information, source MAC address, and destination MAC address. If the outbound interface of packets is an Eth-Trunk or there are multiple next hops (ECMP), run this command to view the outbound interface in packets that contain specified 5-tuple information, source MAC address, and destination MAC address. The command output helps you locate faults and determine the forwarding path.
